verb.description: (of an appearance or action) suggest; be evidence of.
examples: the attractive tree-lined road bespoke money
obtaining the affidavits that it has been necessary to bespeak
and in disgrace bespoke him thus

origin: Old English bisprecan speak up, speak out (see be-, speak), later discuss, decide on, hence order ( bespeak (sense 2), late 16th century).
